posts.post_content:
Brutal, but... as odd as it sounds, I think it's well costed.   
  
A 1/1 with flying +Lord ability isn't really worth the 3 mana. The shroud... maybe over the top lol; but he needed something. Really cool control deck option though. Mana open for a counter spell, this as a fake counterspell, or instant speed card draw.   
  
Brutal no-win situation there; even in aggro it's brutal.

posts.post_content: Cleverly balanced. Cards like [Spellstutter Sprite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spellstutter Sprite) and [Mistbind Clique](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mistbind Clique) very much enjoy being returned to your hand, but shroud prevents you targeting them to do that. Don't get me wrong, Scion is still incredibly powerful, but the removal of a potential tactic is what keeps him from being over the top.
posts.html:
Cleverly balanced. Cards like Spellstutter Sprite and Mistbind Clique very much enjoy being returned to your hand, but shroud prevents you targeting them to do that. Don't get me wrong, Scion is still incredibly powerful, but the removal of a potential tactic is what keeps him from being over the top.

posts.post_content:
If it provided *[troll shroud](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=130498)* the card would be almost unfair, but you don't mind your Fearies having shroud anyways, given that this guy can for example also protect your beloved [Bitter Blossom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bitter Blossom) enchantment.  
On top of that it has *Flash*, meaning you will just respond to any of your opponent's destruction effects by playing this fellow and thin his/her hand by one further threat.

posts.post_content:
@ sootoo   
While I agree with your first point that very very few cards are broken like personally there are only a few cards I find broken sol ring, force of will, power 9 things of that nature. But people arnt always noobs because they can't answer this card this card is amazing an hard to answer. The irony is the answers you mentioned are incredibly narrow bad answers. those cards should never make a mainboard or even a sideboard. Day of judgement, wrath of god effects are the answer to mass shroud typically not narrow flying hate.   
  
On the card itself its nuts flash in mid combat after you've had bitterblossom online for 3-4 turns and you may just kill someone out right. Or as others have said you can counter removal with or maybe just save a creature with the 1 toughness boost

posts.post_content:
Lol @ the guys here who say this card would broken. It´s not even close to being broken. Most people who say cards would be broken, always appear to me, like total noobs who are just too retarded to find any answers to cards.   
  
Sure, Scion of Oona is awesome with a nice army on the field, but when your opponent plays cards like [Tornado Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tornado Elemental), or [Cloudthresher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudthresher), for example, then you also already can leave the game, as long as you have no counter on hand.  
  
However, I totally love this guy, especially when I play my [Mask of Avacyn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mask of Avacyn) the turn before I flash him in. Since he´s only a 1/1 creature and doesn´t have shroud himself, he´s just too vulnerable, but the mask fits perfectly to him, IMO.
posts.html:
Lol @ the guys here who say this card would broken. It´s not even close to being broken. Most people who say cards would be broken, always appear to me, like total noobs who are just too retarded to find any answers to cards.

Sure, Scion of Oona is awesome with a nice army on the field, but when your opponent plays cards like Tornado Elemental, or Cloudthresher, for example, then you also already can leave the game, as long as you have no counter on hand.

However, I totally love this guy, especially when I play my Mask of Avacyn the turn before I flash him in. Since he´s only a 1/1 creature and doesn´t have shroud himself, he´s just too vulnerable, but the mask fits perfectly to him, IMO.
